page.title: 01Talke Landscape
page.content: Clough Hall,Talke and Talke Pits form a residential and recreational intrusion from the urban north east into undulating farmland bordered,to the south,by Bignall End and Red Street.Light industrial activity,with ready access to the A500,is concentrated upon the Jamage Road and West Avenue industrial estates. Interesting buildings include Clough Hall Gothic Revival lodge (by the Pentecostal church),Talke's cross, early 19th century Cross House, 18th-19th century St Martin's Church and timber framed farmhouse,building and cottage,Red Street's Wedgwood Monument,the Stuart Harecastle farmhouse and Neo-Classical lodges flanking Clough Hall Drive entrance.Mid twentieth century workaday architecture is seen in Kidsgrove Fire Station,Talke Social Club and Normid Hypermarket.
